citation.article-title: Centipeda periodontii gen. nov., sp. nov. from human periodontal lesions.

p.s: Centipeda (Cen.ti'pe.da. L. fem.n. centipeda a centipede)
Cells are anaerobic, gram-negative, nonsporeforming, serpentine, and rod-shaped with three or more curves.
Motile by means of flagella inserted in a spiral path along the cell body.
Movement occurs by flexion of the entire cell and rotation around its long axis.
Propionic acid is a major product; variable smaller amounts of acetic, succinic, or lactic acid are produced from carbohydrates.
The G+C content of the type species is 53 mol%.
The type species is Centipeda periodontii sp. nov.
